text: Welcome to howtocookthat.net.

For a printable copy of the recipes simply
go to www.howtocookthat.net

Today we are going to make a Lego logo out
of fondant to go on top of a Lego cake.

If you're not sure how to mix your colors
at a fondant, then go to howtocookthat.net,
the link is just below this video.

Put a piece of baking paper over your logo
that is printed out in the size that you want
it to be on your cake.
Grab your red fondant.
Make sure it's nice and smooth.

And then we want to roll it out to make the
square.

Try not to use any icing sugar if you can,
because it's going to affect your colors,

because you're using bright colors or black
on this logo.
Cut a nice straight line on one edge.

Line that up with your square, just a little
bit off so you can see where it needs to go.

I like to turn the paper to make it easier
to cut.
Then repeat on the other sides.

Once you're finished take a palette knife
or a long straight knife, and just give each

edge a little tap, just to make sure it's
nice and straight and smooth.

Once you finish that, we're going to make
the black border.

So take some black fondant, and roll it out
into a smooth long snake shape.

It takes some practice to be able to make
a long smooth snake, but it needs to be in

even thickness the whole way along, because
otherwise your border will be uneven.

If it doesn't work the first time, just screw
it up and roll it out again.

Starting at one corner, press it along the
edges of the red, giving a pinch at each corner
to make the corner shape.

Then again take your palette knife, tap each
side to make it smooth and straight.
Next, we are going to make the actual lettering.

For that we are going to need some white fondant
again rolled out into an even, long snake
shape.

And then take one end, round it off, and start
forming each letter, starting with the L,

which is the easiest one, so that's a good
place to start.

And then moving on to the E, do it just as
you did with the L; but when you get to the

center bit of the E, just take a piece the
right length, and squash one end of it, and

tuck it underneath the other piece of the
E. Just like that.

And then repeat what you've already done to
make a G and also make your O. Again with

the O squashing one edge to make them join
together.

Then you need to roll out some black fondant,
pick up each letter, and place it onto the

black fondant, referring back and looking
at your logo each time to see what angle they're
on, and how close they need to be together.
Just adjust the positioning with a knife.

Careful not to get any black from the fondant
onto the white letters.

Then using a knife just go ahead and cut around
each of the letters, so you're just left with
a fine black border around the whole thing.
Then take some yellow fondant.

Roll it out much thinner than you have previously
for the other colors.
Roll a really thin, long piece.

And then what you're going to do is simply
place it around the black.
Just start at one point, any point.

Use a knife to push it into the little gaps
that you need to get it into, and wrap it

all the way around, right until you get back
to the beginning.

Then take a palette knife again, make sure
it's even and flat at the top and bottom.

Lift it up, and pop it onto your square using
a knife to ease it off the palette knife,

if you need to, so that it doesn't get out
of shape.

If you've got more time you can leave it to
set hard before you pick it up and move it,
that way it's not going to get out of shape.

And there is your Lego logo, ready to put
on top of your cake.
